result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor T Andrews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
***9-28-2015, Judge Kremers; Court ordered the sentence on Count 2 commuted to 90 days. All other sentencing orders remain the same.***
**10/7/15  Order Amending  JOC (amended):  count two is nine (9) months, sentence on count three is 90 days.
Concurrent with: count three.  Credit for 11 days.

PROBATION REVIEW HEARING  in br. 36, December 18, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.
Probation may be transferred to Illinois if approved by probation.  If the probation is transferred to Illinois, defendant does not have to attend the review hearing.

miscConds.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges.   Bail to apply, if any.  If the costs and surcharges are more than the bail on deposit, defendant to pay remaining costs during probation.  In the alternative a civil judgment will be issued.
Obtain/maintain emloyment or continue in his education.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications

No contact with victim unless approved by the  Court or the agent.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling  as determined appropriate.
Pay supervision fees.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count two.  Credit for 11 days.

miscConds.notes: conditions as listed on count two.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Trevor T Andrews
Current: 2016 W 86th Lane, Merrillville, IN 46410-6460 United States  (Effective: 05-18-2017)
Prior: 5047 Augusta Blvd, Monee, IL 60449 United States

Defendant Trevor T Andrews not in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
The defendant is in absconder status.  There is an apprehension warrant outstanding for the defendant.  No further action taken.
Per Order signed on 10/7/2015:  Sentence on count two is nine months, sentence on count three is 90 days. Sentences remain concurrent to each other and all other sentencing orders remain in effect.

Received, signed and filed:
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction (Amended).
cab

DOC notified postcoviction department that count two was inadvertently commuted to 90 days.  The file was referred to Br. 36 with an amended order to reflect a nine-month sentence on count two and a 90-day sentence on count three.

Received, signed and filed:
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify sentence on count two.

Defendant Trevor T Andrews in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to counts 2 and 3:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 1:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing continued...
.

As to counts 2 and 3:  
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statement by:  Amy C. 
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction as to count 2 and 3 months in the House of Correction as to count 3,  concurrent to each other, with credit for 11 days served.  
Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined appropriate.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court or the agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment or continue his education.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Bail on deposit to apply, remaining bail, if any, to be returned to whoever posted it.  If the costs and surcharges are more than the bail on deposit, defendant is to pay the remaining costs during his time of probation,  in the alternative a civil judgment will be issued.

Probation may be transferred to Illinois if approved by probation.  If the probation is transferred to Illinois, defendant does not have to attend the review hearing.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Trevor T Andrews in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested case be set for Plea & Sentencing.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact.  State does not oppose.  Court orders the No Violent Contact order.  Court allowed for telephone and electronic contact ONLY.  Court further allowed defendant to attend treatment at VA, separate program from victim.

Defendant Trevor T Andrews in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. All conditions of bail remain in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM030362  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-19-15

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Amy C or West Maple Leaf Circle in the City of Greenfield, Wisconsin

Defendant Trevor T Andrews in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Defendant Trevor T Andrews in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
